markdownContent: In any case, while engaged in avoidance strategies a week or two ago, you stumbled upon this short video. You were originally reminded of your short holiday to Japan a few years back, when you were in turns enthralled and appalled by the nightlife in Tokyo. But as you watch again, you think not of the city but of the women, and a particular phrase from the video comes once more to mind: “the unfreedom of poverty or the unfreedom of servitude”. Might this observation be equally true of working women in the historical past?
